Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Hi, I've been pushing through a few jobs and haven't gotten back to ‚òù yet.
Have a quick question re: `HEX`
The hex I used in the above example came out of an online HEX converter with spaces after every 2nd character.  I removed the spaces and seems the HEX was acceptable.
Just put a larger file through a converter.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Output is quite a massive amount (394305 Bytes) of return like this:```0xFF, 0xD8, 0xFF, 0xE0, 0x00,...```

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Should I just remove the `,` and `spaces`, or is it acceptable in this format?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: hex string should only have hex chars

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 0x is not part of the hex, neither is space, commas, or any other separators

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Ok, thanks!
I'll have a look for another converter.

Content: @jl777c is there a Hex converter built into Komodo / Iguana anywhere?  Maybe related to the steganography code?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
```for (i=0; i<len; i++)
                 printf("%02x",&ptr[i*2]);```

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: given a ptr to data, the above will print out the hex, it is one of the simplest "conversions" there is

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Ok, thanks!

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
for `0xFF, 0xD8, 0xFF, 0xE0, 0x00,`
the hex you would use is `ffd8ffe000`

Author: CrisF#3405

Thanks, @gcharang. Did you get that using```for (i=0; i<len; i++)
                 printf("%02x",&ptr[i*2]);```?
The example `0xFF, 0xD8, 0xFF, 0xE0, 0x00,` is just the first part of a 394305 Byte jpg.

Content:
@CrisF no, I just removed "0x" and spaces, converted capital to small for the hex output you have posted
`0xFF, 0xD8, 0xFF, 0xE0, 0x00` is the same as `ffd8ffe000`
